hanzi-su-wiki:
喚

Значения

Громко звать, призывать

Мнемоника

Искажено. Криком 口 заманивать большого человека 大 в пещеру 穴, дабы обратить в раба (вверху).

Варианты

唤
purpleculture_pinyin:
huàn
to call
звонить
rtega_mnemonic:
喚喚RS
唤唤		call, summon, invite, be called
  • mouth 口 calling out brilliantly 奐/央
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 唤)
Pictophonetic: 奐 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
喚起 [ huàn qǐ ]: to waken (to action); to rouse (the masses); to evoke (attention, recollection etc)
喚醒 [ huàn xǐng ]: to wake sb; to rouse
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 奐 [ huàn ] numerous; brilliant
heisig_chinese_memo: These four sled dogs are happily bound together pulling along their master. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: yell, mouth, bound up, four, large, St. Bernard
heisig_story: The mouth on the left is obvious. The rest is harder. Try this: four St. Bernard dogs bound up in a bunch. Together they should supply a clear enough portrait of a yell, provided you are careful to see all four of them. Note how the final stroke of the four is supplied by the long horizontal stroke of the St .Bernard.
koohiiStory1: Think yelp when you hear yell to help dinstinguish this from shout (1508). I think of the sounds that would come from the mouths of the 4 dogs if they were bound up together. I´m imagining lots of yelping.
koohiiStory2: Yell? You mean, Old Yeller. Here, we see four St Bernard dogs all yelling for a chance to play a part in Old Yeller. They´re so loud that you have to bound them, and their mouths, up.
WaniKani_Radicals: 口, 勹, 儿, 大
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You wake up in prison and there is a big mouth full of legs coming really, really close to your own mouth so you scream! Scream because this is terrifying. Scream because it's all you can think to do.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a prison where horrible mouth leg creatures are trying to get in your mouth. You don't want to scream because they might get in there, but you can't help it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You scream and scream and scream until a door bursts open. It's Genghis Khan (かん) and he looks mad. Apparently your screaming is bothering him and now he's gonna give you a real reason to scream.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine Genghis Khan doing something to make you scream. What is it? What could Genghis Khan do that's worse than what's already happening to you?
Ru_Radicals: 儿 (ножки), 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 勹 (обёртка), 口 (рот), 大 (большой)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the brilliant (奐) mouth (口) yells
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The first thing that comes to mind when thinking of a victorian lady is her call out for help with her mouth and faint into a mans arms.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " mouth ", " huan " sound. The original meaning is to call, call. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Call, 𧦝 also. From the mouth, Huansheng." Such as "Shishuo New Language." "Ren Dan": "(Wen Taizhen) and Yu Liangshan, Yu Fang called Liangzhong and said: "Qing can redeem me!"" "Yuefu Poetry Collection. Horizontally blowing tunes. "Mulan Poetry": "I don't hear the voice of my grandfather and mother calling women, but I hear Yanshan Hu Qiming tweeted."

" Call " also means the cry of an animal. Such as "Yuefu Poetry Collection. Miscellaneous songs. "The Song of the Rooster": "The East wants the star to be rotten, and the rooster calls on the altar in the morning of Runan." Liu Xiyi of the Tang Dynasty "Chunri on behalf of the boudoir": "The birds in the forest call, and the flowers wait outside.

" Call " means to call on or call. Such as "The Biography of Ancient Lies. Section Yi Chuan. "Lu Qiu Jie Fu": "Mother makes people call women, even to those who pick mulberry." Tang Dynasty Chen Ziang "To make up for Qiao Que Qing Wucheng Hall": "The ministers will be the emperors of this month and day, and they will call the ministers in Wucheng Hall. Enter, ask Gu Dulu and other thieves, please."

" Call " also means to wake up. For example, in the Tang Dynasty Du Fu "A hundred rhymes from the Qiu Rikui Mansion to the Zheng Jian Li guest": "Arouse the urgency of scratching the head and help with a few shoes." "Zhu Zi Linguistics. Learn six. Perseverance: "The original mind of a person is unclear, just like a person who sleeps and faints without knowing that there is this body. You must be awakened to know."
humanum_short_description_en: From " mouth ", " huan " sound. The original meaning is to call, call, and also mean to call.
humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「奐」聲。本義是呼叫、呼喚。《說文新附》：「喚，𧦝也。从口，奐聲。」如《世說新語．任誕》：「（溫太真）與庾亮善，於舫中大喚亮曰：『卿可贖我！』」《樂府詩集．橫吹曲辭．木蘭詩》：「不聞爺孃喚女聲，但聞燕山胡騎鳴啾啾。」

　　「喚」也表示動物的啼叫。如《樂府詩集．雜歌謠辭．雞鳴歌》：「東方欲明星爛爛，汝南晨雞登壇喚。」唐代劉希夷〈代閨人春日〉：「林間鳥鳴喚，戶外花相待。」

　　「喚」表示招之使來、召喚。如《古列女傳．節義傳．魯秋潔婦》：「母使人喚婦，至，乃向採桑者也。」唐代陳子昂〈為喬補闕慶武成殿表〉：「臣以今月日奉敕，於武成殿喚臣入，問骨篤祿等賊請降事。」

　　「喚」還表示喚醒。如唐代杜甫〈秋日夔府詠懷奉寄鄭監李賓客一百韻〉：「喚起搔頭急，扶行幾履穿。」《朱子語類．學六．持守》：「人之本心不明，一如睡人都昏了，不知有此身。須是喚醒，方知。」
humanum_short_description: 從「口」，「奐」聲。本義是呼叫、呼喚，亦表示召喚。

Pinyin: huàn
English Definition: to call
Total strokes: 12; Radical: 口
Pictophonetic: 奐 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:

    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 奐 [ huàn ] numerous; brilliant
Example Words:

喚醒 [ huàn xǐng ]: to wake sb; to rouse

從「 口 」，「 奐 」聲。本義是呼叫、呼喚。《說文新附》：「喚，𧦝也。从口，奐聲。」如《世說新語．任誕》：「（溫太真）與庾亮善，於舫中大喚亮曰：『卿可贖我！』」《樂府詩集．橫吹曲辭．木蘭詩》：「不聞爺孃喚女聲，但聞燕山胡騎鳴啾啾。」 「 喚 」也表示動物的啼叫。如《樂府詩集．雜歌謠辭．雞鳴歌》：「東方欲明星爛爛，汝南晨雞登壇喚。」唐代劉希夷〈代閨人春日〉：「林間鳥鳴喚，戶外花相待。」 「 喚 」表示招之使來、召喚。如《古列女傳．節義傳．魯秋潔婦》：「母使人喚婦，至，乃向採桑者也。」唐代陳子昂〈為喬補闕慶武成殿表〉：「臣以今月日奉敕，於武成殿喚臣入，問骨篤祿等賊請降事。」 「 喚 」還表示喚醒。如唐代杜甫〈秋日夔府詠懷奉寄鄭監李賓客一百韻〉：「喚起搔頭急，扶行幾履穿。」《朱子語類．學六．持守》：「人之本心不明，一如睡人都昏了，不知有此身。須是喚醒，方知。」

喚字的基本解释

喚
huàn
同“唤”。

喚字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huàn］
“唤1”的旧字形。

喚字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　喚； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页199第01
【唐韻】呼貫切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】呼玩切，?音煥。【說文】呼也。【王褒·洞簫賦】哮呷?喚。【註】大聲也。　又【韓愈·贈同遊詩】喚起窻全曙。【註】黃庭堅云：喚起，禽名，聲如人，絡繹員轉淸亮，偏於春曉鳴，江南謂之春煥。【復齋復錄】予嘗讀唐顧渚山茶記曰：顧渚山中有鳥，如鸜鵒而色蒼，每至正二月作聲，曰春起也，三四月云春去也，採茶人呼爲煥春鳥。【說文】古通作奐。【玉篇】本作嚾。【集韻】亦作讙。

喚字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

喚字的起名意思

同"唤"。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［huàn］
The old glyph of "Call 1".
Call
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　 Huan; Kangxi strokes: 12; page number: page 199 01
[Tang Yun] Hu Guanqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zheng Yun] Huwanqie,? Yin Huan. [Said Wen] Hu Ye. [Wang Bao·Dongxiao Fu] Roar? Call. [Note] Loudly too.　[Han Yu·Gift Tongyou Poems] evokes the dawn of the sky. [Note] Huang Tingjianyun: It evokes, a bird’s name, a sound like a person, the interpreter turns bright, leaning towards Chunxiaoming, Jiangnan is called Chunhuan. [Fu Zhai Re-recorded] Preliminary reading of the Guzhu Mountain Tea Notes of the Tang Dynasty: There are birds in the Guzhu Mountain, which are like gibbons and pale. The tea people call it Huanchun bird. [Speaking text] Gu Tong makes Huan. [Jade articles] This is for 嚾. [Ji Yun] also made a mistake.

huàn
вм. 唤
Radicals: 口, 勹, 儿, 大  (mouth, prison, legs, big)
Meaning Mnemonic
You wake up in prison and there is a big mouth full of legs coming really, really close to your own mouth so you scream! Scream because this is terrifying. Scream because it's all you can think to do.
Imagine a prison where horrible mouth leg creatures are trying to get in your mouth. You don't want to scream because they might get in there, but you can't help it.
Reading Mnemonic
You scream and scream and scream until a door bursts open. It's Genghis Khan (かん) and he looks mad. Apparently your screaming is bothering him and now he's gonna give you a real reason to scream.
Imagine Genghis Khan doing something to make you scream. What is it? What could Genghis Khan do that's worse than what's already happening to you?
